derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 19th cent.: perhaps an abbreviation of scatter, or perhaps from the sound of a hiss (used to drive an animal away) + -cat
1960s: abbreviation of modern Latin Scatophagidae, from Greek skatophagos 'dung-eating' (because the fish is often found beside sewage outlets)

entry.tran: (爵士乐中不唱歌词的)拟声唱法
entry.def: Scat is a type of jazz singing in which the singer sings sounds rather than complete words.

means.word_mean: 1. singing jazz; the singer substitutes nonsense syllables for the words of the song and tries to sound like a musical instrument
